title: League of Legends Store Beta
body:
Hey Everyone,

As I'm sure you've heard by now, we are finally live with our merch beta store ( http://merch.riotgames.com ) , awww yeah!

We wanted to create a central hub for feedback on the store, and I'll be here, along with Bradmore and Tocelote to respond to feedback you have throughout the day.

EDIT - Working on performance issues atm, sorry all.

D

replies.body:
To the people complaining about the prices and amount of items keep in mind this is a BETA. Which means they won't have everything you ever wanted. Give them time to figure out price points and what products they will be adding over time.

That being said. I have a question in terms of the figures. Who came up with the designs for them?

Thanks for the comment! I think when people get items in hand they will understand price points better, these aren't your average materials we are using, really wanted a focus and commitment on quality. That being said, Bradmore posted on reddit:

'We also understand the need to have multiple price points in the store across our categories and will be building out the assortment over time to reflect that goal. We’ll been adding items that are less expensive, as well as items that more expensive as we build out the store.'

As for the figure designs, all in-house with our artists working on League, which really lend to the authenticity of these. Think they turned out well, and new ones in the hopper continue to get better.

> these aren't your average materials

Well you might want to make it clear in the products description exactly what they're made off and why it's higher quality. Otherwise it just looks like you're overpricing stuff.

This sounds like Mellow Mushroom pricing scheme.  "We know it looks like a regular pizza, but trust us.  This cheese is of the utmost quality from a special area of Italy that no one else has.  It's definitely worth being a bit more expensive."  I give in and order the pizza.  I take a bite and realize that the cheese tastes exactly the same as Pizza Hut, but I paid double the price.

I know you guys want to make money.  You're a business.  But the prices are radically ridiculous.  It's like you're looking to gain a ton of capital quickly so you can expand the store into more things when it launches for real.  Let's go through everything.

1. Hoodies at $80 are too much.  That's a $50 hoodie.  Remember a few months ago how Riot lowered the prices on some skins that the community felt did not meet the standards set for their price points.  Riot finally gave in and lowered them, stating that "though we feel the skins do meet the previous price points, they do not visually show it very well."  In other words, even though Pink Taric may have been 975 quality, to the players comparing other 975 skins to it, it looked like a glorified recolor.  So it was lowered.  The hoodies may be made of some of the best material around, and I'm sure you put your heart into it.  But I'm not paying for your heart.  I'm paying for a hoodie.  And that hoodie looks like it's worth $50.  "We want it to last a long time though!"  I'm sure you do.  And I can go buy a $20 hoodie at Walmart that'll last me five years easy.  What makes it worth $80?  Saying you're using certain materials and it glows isn't something we can see visually in the picture and won't be that big of an attraction to those looking to purchase it.  You're telling me there's a special kind of cheese in it, but it tastes the same as Pizza Hut.  At the end of the day, it's still just a hoodie.

2.  Mini figurines costing $25 is funny.  It's just as big as a coffee cup, it's not an in game model of the champion, and it looks cheap.  Why would I buy this for $25 when I can buy something of (what looks like) better quality in a Skylander or Amiibo figure that is only $10-$15?  

3.  T-shirts are debatable I suppose.  I'd like to see them around $20 and accept it.  $20 is a bit much for me, but I don't think $25 is extremely overpriced on these or anything.

4.  Plushes and hats are about $10 too much for each of their respective prices.  I can go to Build a Bear and get a $15 bear and sow a buttonon it's eye if I want it that bad.  And the hats are the worst offenders of overpriced in the store I'd say.  I wanted a Teemo hat a few years ago, so I went to the old Riot store and looked for one.  $40.  I laughed at the thought of paying $40 for a Teemo hat.  I then went to eBay and searched for Teemo hat and found one for $3 with free shipping.  It was a no brainer.  I say the same thing now.  $20-$25 for one of these hats is too much, especially when I can go to eBay and get them for 90% cheaper than here.  And before people say "it was a fake", it was completely legit.  Had every single thing any other Teemo hat has.  

5.  The Thresh statue is laughable.  $80 for it?  Come on now Riot.  You know as well as I do that that is a $50 statue.  You pay $15 for each of those statues from your manufacturer.  I bought a Pulsefire Ezreal statue on eBay for $50 and felt it was a decent price.  $80 is just bad.  It's like you aren't even trying.  And don't use the Mellow Mushroom argument on me here.  You can claim to use the best processes and best looking materials, but to an outsider, it doesn't look worth $80 at all.

6.  Posters should be $10.  Great posters, too much.  I can take the pictures of those posters, go to a print store in town, and get them to print me one off for $5.  


These are just my opinions obviously.  And I know that there are enough people who play League who have big enough wallets that you'll probably sell out of all your products.  But you alienate the vast portion of your fanbase with these price points.  "When we launch, we're going to have many more price points."  Yea, I believe you.  But if these previews are an indication of what you feel is the price point of this quality product, I can only imagine the terrible quality I'd get for a $10 purchase.  

I'm not trying to be rude or accuse you of price gouging here, but to an outsider, that's what it looks like.  You may be the official store, but the people with the pockets deep enough to consistently purchase at this price will fall drastically and you'll be making no money quickly.  When only 1-2% of your playerbase feels these are fair prices, you're in trouble.

And yes, I'm aware that this is a Beta.  I'm just afraid that Beta will move forward quickly into Live and prices will stay super high.  As my experience with Riot has been over the years, if it hits Beta, it'll take pitchforks and death threats to stop it from going Live.  And even then, that's only if Riot has an affinity for that champion (no one at Riot liked old Trundle, but they all love Lee Sin).  I want Riot to be successful as well, but this isn't the way to do it.  We're paying $30 extra on some products here just for the name brand.  

And this time next year, I'll be able to go to a third party seller and get these things for half of what they cost now.  


Last thing then I'm done.  Riot better hope those Thresh hoodies are as high quality as they want us to believe.  Because the first one that isn't as high quality as they're building it up to be, Reddit is going to explode and it's going to be a PR nightmare.

Community OP

Big suggestion on the figures/statues: Please include what they are made out of in the item description.  $70.00 US for that Thresh statue is a bit much for something that appears to be the same quality as $25-$30.00 NECA/DC Direct statues.  For merchandise like that materials can make all the difference in determining value.  Don't be vague like "these aren't your average materials we are using", the people that are going to buy statues/toys of your characters know what they are getting into and want to know what they are made out of before purchasing.

The Thresh statue is made of PVC and ABS plastic and we worked with our manufacturing partner to push to introduce more detail and texture via investments in tooling (e.g, to create the leathery scaling on Thresh's legs) and paint operations to accurately capture the iridescence of his coat. Hope that helps!
Also, dimensions are important - how big is the Tibbers plush, for instance?
Tibbers in 16" tall. We'll get that on to the site. Thx!

Hello there!
I'm kinda confused, because on the EU Shop Site there's no Rammus Poro, does this mean that's only exclusive for NA? And another question is: why are the prices in $ and € identical? I mean there has to be some difference because of the exchange rate of dollar and euro. So its kinda unfair that the stuff in EU is more expensive than in NA.
Greets

Rammus poro for EU was held up in customs unfortunately. An allotment is coming for EU but it was not ready for the launch of beta. 

Regarding EU and NA pricing-- the difference is driven by VAT and duties. EU prices include VAT and NA prices do not.

So what's your profit margin on the Thresh/Demacia Hoodie? Can't imagine those will be very fast movers at an 85$ price point O.o Unless I missed something where they're like rated for -30 degrees weather or something, lol. Why would anyone buy them is what I'm asking, what's your selling point. The designs aren't particularly detailed, is the material super high quality? If you don't have like a 20/80 cost/profit margin on these (like they cost 20$ to make and you make 65$) why did they cost so much to make? 

Make me want one. The Demacia Hoodie is pretty bangin, but not anywhere near 85$ bangin if it's just a cotton/poly blend hoodie with an iron-on design.

Those hoodies are very high quality. It's tough to tell from the pics, and we probably need to do better with the product descriptions, but per Bradmore: 'we invested in everything from the fabric quality and weight (350gsm French terry) to finishes like the custom zipper pull and premium commercial grade glow ink that is the best in the market for brightness and duration. We wanted these hoodies to not only look and feel great, but also last a long time.'

Looks like they are too pricey for a lot of people, so going to work on designing other hoodies that are less expensive.
Pink Taric argument.
Pink Taric would take my wallet. Pink Taric halloween costume plz

I don't think you understand what I mean.  Pink Taric used to be 975 RP even though fans thought it didn't meet the standards set  by Riot for that price point.  And when compared to other products at that price point, it didn't look like it met the standard either.  

Riot responded by lowering the price point to 750, stating that even though they felt 975 was a fair point, they understood that to onlookers, they could not see the difference.  $80 for a hoodie?  I can buy an $80 hoodie from plenty of other outlets that I could wear in the Arctic and be perfectly warm.  This looks like a light hoodie with a design on it.  You can tell me all day that it's worth $80, but I see a $40-$50 hoodie.  You can tell me all day you think Pink Taric is worth 975 RP.  But I see a 750 RP skin.
The detailing on the Demacia Hoodie actually features gold metallic embroidery as opposed to an iron-on design. We'll clarify that on the site. Thanks for the feedback.

Copy/paste before my thread is inevitably buried in the swarm that comes with a red post.


Prices are about what I expected to see. For everyone that might complain about their hoodie prices, just search that phrase in Google. You'll see them go anywhere from $70-$130, so it's about normal. Shirts are priced at what I've seen at conventions and clothing stores.

Figures are meh honestly. I've paid less for better looking figmas. The Thresh statue is too detailed, which ended up making it look like a mess in my opinion. I think I would've liked it more if you went with a New Dawn kind of style for it with smoother geometry. Not a fan of the style for the chibis, but that's a personal opinion as well.

Posters are nice, if you like posters. Nothing we've never seen before though.  Plushies look good too if you like plushies.

I might get a shirt or two for my Christmas shopping. Might also actually buy the mousepad just to have something nifty for my desk honestly.

7/10. Looking forward to seeing what they release in the future :)
Thanks for the feedback. Trying our best, and learning as we go.

Please consider slashing EU prices at least 20% because the 1:1 Dollar-Euro translation really gets on people's nerves. An 85$ Hoodie is already expensive. But that's less than 70 euro by today's currency exchange values. Asking 80 Euro for it is a 13% increase in price.
Hey there, VAT is included in EU pricing while sales tax isn't included for NA prices. Prices across regions are very comparable.

Example: An in-game Pirate Gragas skin that you can only unlock via a code you receive when you buy the Gragas figurine in the merch store. Or a Thresh lantern ward skin that's only available via a code that comes with the merch statue?

Hey,  I bought some stuff,  really happy this is here,  I have been looking for Merch since I went to PAX Prime and there was no store at the LCS regionals.

The prices are a bit high, BUT this stuff is so rare that they are still worth it.  If the market gets flooded I am not sure they can hold these price points, but I am happy to pay this now, just to get stuff.

I am also looking forward to new stuff,  I hope you will consider some community involvement with this,  Sites like TeeFury let people submit designs it would be cool if this was THE PLACE for that kind of thing league related.

As a side, one of the Rioters at PAX had a super awesome Ziggs shirt that kinda looked like the rengar one you have,  (couldn't find a good picture of it but he wore it to the design panel)  As a Ziggs main, I would love that shirt.  Any chance we will see it?

Thanks again for this store,  I look forward to seeing MOAR!
Really want to explore the crowd-sourced opportunities, it's something we have on our plate but nothing incoming anytime soon.

I remember on J!NX they had a Blitzcrank and Malzahar hoodie, Are you guys going to sell those in the merch store?
I really wanted to buy one but they aren't available anymore. :C
Sorry, those have been sunsetted. They weren't at the quality we needed for the site. Had a lot of complaints on them after some wear and tear.

First off everything looks very high quality! So that's always awesome for an online shop.

Second, ALMOST everything is at a price that i expected an item of that type would be. For example, i expected plushies to be $20-$30, posters to be in the range of $10-$20, Figures to be $20-$40.

What i did NOT expect was a hoodie to be $60-$90. $50 is generally an average price so $60 wouldn't be a huge strech... but $85? Holy crap! What made them so expensive? Is the demacian symbol hand stitched?

Bradmore posted on Reddit saying this "May be tough to tell from pictures without these actually being in the wild, but using the Thresh hoodies as an example, we invested in everything from the fabric quality and weight (350gsm French terry) to finishes like the custom zipper pull and premium commercial grade glow ink that is the best in the market for brightness and duration. We wanted these hoodies to not only look and feel great, but also last a long time."

Edit: Also from what i've seen from Googling is that the kind of fabric they use for sweaters is 3-7 US Dollars per kilogram

I'm wearing a hoody right now i've had for 5 years that was only $40. Quality is one thing, over quality is another. I don't think it needs to be $85 to be high quality. There is obviously a lot of details in it, the stitching of the demacian symbol on both breasts, the zipper design, and the lining around the zipper. But to constitute $35 more dollars? idk, i'm not the marketing team. I'm guessing their desired profit is probably the $35 above average price.
